intro: Eriocaulon linearifolium, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces dense clusters of tiny, spike-like inflorescences, which are typically pale green to brown in color. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in temperate regions. Eriocaulon linearifolium plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native wetland habitats.
